inclusion.criterion: audiogram performed as standard of care for evaluation and management of chronic tinnitus
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: study drug prescribed by a physician in the Department of the Otolaryngology at UC Davis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: transdermal lidocaine patches administered to the participant's torso
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patches applied first thing in the morning and kept on for twelve hours
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patient information recorded in the UC Davis Electronic Medical Record (EMR)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: TFI surveys provided for the participants
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: study visits after completion of informed consent
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: participant prescribed thirty transdermal lidocaine patches
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: participant asked to follow-up in 4 weeks by phone
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: previous exposure to lidocaine as a treatment for tinnitus
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: taking medications, herbal remedies and supplements that may interact with lidocaine
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 67-year-old healthy woman with no underlying disease, menopausal and has 4 children. She takes daily multivitamins and anti-hypertensive drugs.
